ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: that Day he will be driven to your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To your Lord then will be the driving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day you will be driven to your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: that will be the time to be driven to one's Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: On that day, the herding will be only towards your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The drive will be on that Day to your Lord!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: To your Lord on that day shall be the driving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: upon that day unto thy Lord shall be the driving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Unto thy Lord that day will be the driving.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: on that Day he will be driven towards your Lord!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Unto thy Lord that Day is the drive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: that day he shall be driven toward your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That Day the Drive will be (all) to thy Lord!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The drive will be, on that Day, to your Lord (Allah)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: upon that Day the driving shall be to your Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To your Lord on that Day is the drive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:30] on that day to your Lord will be the driving [of the souls] (al-masāq means al-sawq; this indicates the operator of the [above] idhā, ‘when’, the meaning being: ‘when the soul reaches the throat, it will be driven towards the judgement of its Lord’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Unto thy Lord that day) the Day of Judgement (will be the driving) the return of all created beings.
